profile.name: Keith Wilkinson
profile.title: Senior Stationary Engineer
profile.tagline: Water treatment operations, facility management, and regulatory compliance.

summary: Highly experienced and certified Water Treatment Operator and Senior Stationary Engineer with over 9 years of progressive experience within the San Francisco Public Utilities Commission and a total of 14 years in facility maintenance and building engineering, including extensive hazardous waste management and regulatory compliance. Proven ability to lead teams, manage complex projects (including the Sunol Valley Water Treatment Plant ozone facility construction project), and ensure regulatory compliance including CERS, HazWaste, and fuel systems.

currently.role: Senior Stationary Engineer at SFPUC Sunol Valley Water Treatment Plant.
currently.focus: Operational reliability, hazardous waste compliance, asset management, and team development.
currently.learning: AI applications in water operations, competency-based workforce development, and digital innovation.

highlights: Oversaw all operations, maintenance, and regulatory compliance for the Sunol Valley Water Treatment Plant.
Managed a team of 13 operators and maintenance staff, providing leadership, training, and performance management.
Managed the plant's hazardous waste generation site ensuring compliance with CERS reporting, storage, transportation, and disposal.
Developed and revised SOPs for hazardous waste management, safety protocols, and critical plant processes.
Collaborated with County Health Departments and regulatory agencies for inspections and compliance.
Utilized Maximo for asset creation, job plan development, and maintenance planning.

experience.role: Acting Chief Construction Liaison of Operations
highlights: Served as Acting Chief Construction Liaison for a major ozone facility project.
Ensured seamless integration planning for new ozone systems into existing plant operations.
Collaborated with engineers, contractors, and operations staff on project execution.
Managed project documentation and communication across all stakeholders.
Supervised Water Treatment Operators and maintenance staff overseeing all facility assets.
Developed and updated work orders in Maximo for tracking, prioritization, and completion of maintenance tasks.
Managed hazardous waste generation site with full CERS compliance.
Provided comprehensive training on hazardous waste management, safety procedures, and equipment operation.
Coordinated with County Health Departments for site inspections and compliance.
Oversaw fuel system management and regulatory compliance.

certifications: Grade T5 Water Treatment Operator Certification (California)

operations: Water treatment processes (coagulation, flocculation, sedimentation, filtration, disinfection, ozone)
Equipment O&M (pumps, motors, valves, chemical feed, SCADA, ozone systems)
Preventative maintenance and asset lifecycle management
compliance: Hazardous waste management (CERS reporting, storage, transport, disposal)
emerging_tech: City Science Lab @ San Francisco participant

communication: BAYWORK 2026 Water Summit planner and presenter
associations: Abundance Network — working groups: Local Governance and AI x Procedural Bloat
